com.outsideinsdk
Class Export

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.outsideinsdk.Export
public class Export
extends java.lang.Object

The Export class represents the interface for performing file conversions. These conversions are done by making calls to the convert method, which can be called repeatedly for any instance of this class. It also allows for the setting of conversion properties that are persistant across convert calls.

See Also:
java.util.Properties

Method Detail

getRuntimeProperties

public java.util.Properties getRuntimeProperties()
Gets the current properties.
Returns:
A copy of the properties currently associated with this conversion.

setRuntimeProperties

public void setRuntimeProperties(java.util.Properties properties)
Sets the properties to be used for all subsequent conversions executed by this Export object. These properties are copied to protect them from modifications external to this object.
Parameters:
properties - The properties to use when executing conversions.

convert

public ExportStatusCode convert(java.lang.String inputPath,
                                java.lang.String outputPath,
                                java.lang.String outputFormat)
Convert a file by executing a native process with no timeout. Use the supplied parameters and the previously set properties to construct a command line String array. Execute this command line using a Runtime.exec method, wait for the process to complete, capture the return value, wrap it in an ExportStatusCode and return.
Parameters:
inputPath - The full pathname of the file to convert.
outputPath - The full pathname of the destination file for the conversion.
outputFormat - The type of format to convert the inputPath file into. See ExportFormat for the available format types.
Returns:
Return value of the conversion wrapped as an ExportStatusCode.

convert

public ExportStatusCode convert(java.lang.String inputPath,
                                java.lang.String outputPath,
                                java.lang.String outputFormat,
                                long timeout)
Convert a file by executing a native process. Use the supplied parameters and the previously set properties to construct a command line String array. Execute this command line using a Runtime.exec method, wait for the process to complete, capture the return value, wrap it in an ExportStatusCode and return.
Parameters:
inputPath - The full pathname of the file to convert.
outputPath - The full pathname of the destination file for the conversion.
outputFormat - The type of format to convert the inputPath file into. See ExportFormat for the available format types.
timeout - Timeout interval in milliseconds; 0 means no timeout.
Returns:
Return value of the conversion wrapped as an ExportStatusCode.
